A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. She is then faced with having to juggle between her hatred for the horse and her friends against a great horse-racing fix.

This is, without a doubt, one of my favorite Columbo episodes ever. Leland follows the story of Leland P. He visits a local psychologist, Dr. Roslyn Berlin (Jennifer Jason Leigh), for counseling.

Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting budget was very cheap and the characters developed rather slow. It is missing many things that a better film would have. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it quite a bit more by the end. "Les Valseuses" is a classic piece of French Comedic cinema that parody a couple of genres, with one of them being the “Yakuza film” as seen in the first few moments.
